Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 02:37PM shean wrote: Thank you all for your encouraging responses - and guess what, my friend has an appointment to see a Dr. at John Hopkins tomorrow evening. Today I read the Jane Brody article in the science section of the times, and it was all about living with cancer (until there is a cure) keeping it in remission, It mentions a Dr Esteva at the Anderson Center in Houston. I sent a copy to her, which she can read before going for her appointment. Unfortunately I don't live in the same city, and can't go with her but she will take a tape recorder. I will also send her a link to your responses. Thank you so very much.

Posts.Title: Recurrence and metastasis to the lung shean shean

Posts.Content: shean wrote: My friend has had a biopsy of tumors in her lung, after a recurrence of cancer in her breast, and has learned that the breast cancer cells have entered her lung. She has been unable to see an oncologist to develop a plan of action, because the specialists don't call back to arrange an appointment. She is being given the impression that there is nothing that can be done, except to breath shallow and not laugh because this might cause a collapse of the lung. Log in to post a reply
